definition: knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs

sentences.english: He is deadly with a blade.
Xiao li fly knife moment, KuangXiang into little eunuch.
sentences.chinese: 小李飛刀一瞬間，匡翔變成小太監。

sentences.english: The Knife Hooks are designed by TC Studio.
sentences.chinese: 這種飛刀衣掛由TC工作室設計。

sentences.english: The mom of Dagger Siu Lee, but she passed away.
sentences.chinese: 就是小李飛刀他娘，可惜她已經過世了。

sentences.english: One of the bandits died then, died from the knife she hurled as she threw open the door.
sentences.chinese: 她撞開房門，扔出一把飛刀，一名強盜應聲倒地。

sentences.english: My brother cleans his fingernails with one of his throwing daggers.
sentences.chinese: 我弟弟用他其中一把飛刀清潔他的手指甲。

definition: to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
also written 機槍|机枪/machine gun
to shoot dead (with a gun, or bow and arrow)
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
